text: hey guys it's Elise welcome back to my
cupcake addiction today we're going to
be making a no-bake strawberry milkshake
tart these are amazing because among
other ingredients these hinge on the use
of strawberry milk powder so they
actually taste like a strawberry
milkshake as well as a strawberry milk
powder I've got some milk I've got some
powdered sugar some crushed Oreo cookies
a little bit of whipping cream some
sprinkles for decorating I've got some
cream cheese and some melted butter and
I'm going to add just a touch of pink
food coloring because I want mine to
look really extra strawberry for all of
your measurements quantities and
conversions you can head to the my
cupcake addiction comm website where you
can print that recipe out and save it
for later the first thing that you want
to do is you want to take your melted
butter and we're going to pour it over
our Oreo cookies and you're going to
stir that through to make your easy no
bake crust
particularly for these tarts you do want
to make sure that your Oreos are really
nicely crushed so normally I'd say you
could crush them using a ziplock bag but
for these I would recommend putting them
into a blender or a food processor so
you get a really nice fine crumb I'm
going to be presenting these today as
little mini milkshake tartlets you could
use a large 9-inch springform pan you
could use a 9 to 10 inch tart pan but
I'm going to use 6 little tiny I think
they're about 4 inch tart pans because I
love the way they look when they're
kinda tiny and small perfect now once
that's all the way mixture you want to
grab your tart pans and we're going to
evenly divide the mix between my 6
little mini tart pans I'm just going to
take sort of even size spoons and just
spoon into each of the pans and then
I'll keep doing that until all of my
mixes being used alright once it's all
into your little pans you just want to
bring out your inner mud pie maker and
we're just going to press it down you do
want to make sure that you're pressing
it really nice up those sidewalls and
giving it kind of a bit of a neat edge
at the top so make sure that you're
really firmly pushing it down and as
you're pushing it down you're also kind
of like squeezing that mixture of the
sides so that it's not all trapped on
the bottom of your tart pan so the needy
you get those top edges the needy
your tasks are going to turnout overall
now while they're sitting and you can

doesn't matter here we're going to
combine our strawberry milk powder and
milk together just like a strawberry

you can pour it into a larger Bowl this
bowl needs to be big enough to
incorporate everything so for me I've
got quite a large bowl the smell of

stick strawberry milk goes in with that

time to add it so I'm just going to pop
in just a little dollar but I want this
to be fluorescent pink but I do just
want to give it that little bit more of
a kick of color perfect using an
electric mixer we're going to mix that
on high until it resembles like a creamy
mousse a very pink creamy mousse perfect
once that one's all ready to go we're
going to whip the cream so I'm using a
whipping cream which has got about a
thirty five percent milk fat and we're
going to semi whip it so when you send
me with a cream you want to make sure
that it's just starting to thicken up
but that your beaters aren't necessarily
leaving marks in it because once we mix
it through our pink mix that's going to
continue to whip it and we don't want to
have over whipped cream in our finished
product
alright so when I say semi whipped it's
not liquid anymore it is definitely a
lot thicker but it will just slide
straight off a spoon or a spatula that's
the consistency that we're going for you
want to take that mixture now and we're
going to gently fold it through our
strawberry mixture and this is where we
kind of continue to whip the cream a
little bit the cream is going to give
not only stability to our little tarts
it's also going to give a light
fluffiness that's going to really
complement that strawberry milkshake
flavor as I fold that mix through I'm
using nice big sweeping strokes and
you're going to fold that all the way
through till it looks like a beautiful
light pink strawberry mousse folding it
with these great big strokes also helps
to keep the air in that cream if you try
to whip it too much or too hard you can
kind of knock the air out of it and you
don't get as much like fluffiness
perfect that looks pretty delicious to

you start to drag those brown or
Oh crumbs for everything so you want to
make sure that you've got enough mix in
each type to start with I'm going to use
an offset spatula if you don't have one

highly recommend getting one this is one
of my most used tools so what I'm going
to do is being careful not to touch the
outside edges I'm just going to work
back and forward and then as I'm happy

even I'm going to start in the middle
and I'm gonna do one sweep out to one
side and one sweep out to the other
that's all you want to do because if you
now start trying to work that back and
forward you're going to drag Oreo cookie

top so try to be really neat here
alright so there might not look like
much just yet but those are your

all of that creamy mixture doesn't

perfect now just so that you guys can

maybe if you give it a good shake but
